ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Study group
Interview modality
What language was the assessment completed in?
How was Testing/Evaluation Performed?
Where do you usually sleep at night?
Notes: 1=Living alone – independent living situation; 2=Supported living arrangement – may include other residents, some supervision but not daily on site management; 3=Structured environment – e.g., board and care, group home, halfway house; 4=Family of origin – e.g., parents, grandparents, siblings or other; 5=Family of orientation – e.g., spouse, children; 6=Homeless shelter or on the street; 7= Other living situation

Approximately how long during the last 30 days would you say you were able to take your medication for mental health or emotional problems?
Notes: 0=No indication of any psychiatric medication; 1=Took medicine all or most of the time; 2= Took medication most of the time and/or at a lower dose than indicated; 3=Took medication about half the time; 4=Took medication sporadically or less than half the time; 5=Did not take medication in any case

ElementDescription: How much support or help did you receive in taking your medications for mental health or emotional problems in the last 30 days? E.g. pick up your medicines, did someone remind you if you forgot to do it?
Notes: 1=Nothing, he took his meds regardless; 2= Received encouragement, encouragement or reminders. (Includes prescription recall); 3=Received supervision (e.g. the medication is administered by someone else); 4=No aplica, no toma medicamentos

ElementDescription: During the past 30 days, have you met with a staff member who is helping you get a job in the community or furthering your education? (Supported employment/education)

If you have met with a staff member who is helping you get a job in the community or furthering your education during the last 30 days, average duration of this type of consultation (minutes)
How many sessions were in community (non-clinical) settings?

If a staff member met with you and/or your family to help you and them understand and address your problems, average duration of this type of consultation (minutes)

Number of outpatient consultations of this type
Average duration of this type of consultation (minutes)
Have you received services to help you achieve personal strength or personal resilience by learning to manage your illness and improve your ability to function?
Notes: 1=Not at all; 2=A little bit; 3=Somewhat; 4=Considerably; 5=A great deal

ElementDescription: Does your doctor keep track of your symptoms and medications using computerized medical records?
Does your doctor pay attention to your individual symptoms and side effects when reviewing your prescription?
In general, would you say your health is:
Notes: 1= Excellent; 2= Very Good; 3= Good; 4= Fair; 5= Poor ; 888=Don't Know/not sure; -999=Missing

ElementDescription: Moderate activities, such as moving a table, pushing a vacuum cleaner, does your health now limit you a lot, limit you a little, or not limit you at all?
Notes: 1 = Yes, limited a lot; 2 = Yes, limited a little; 3 = No, not limited at all

ElementDescription: Climbing several flights of stairs. Does your health now limit you a lot, limit you a little, or not limit you at all?
Notes: 1 = Yes, limited a lot; 2 = Yes, limited a little; 3 = No, not limited at all; -999=Missing

ElementDescription: During the past 30 days, have you achieved less than you wanted at work or other regular daily activities as a result of your physical health?
During the past 30 days, have you been limited by the type of work or other activities at work or other regular daily activities as a result of your physical health?
During the past 30 days, did you achieve less than you would like at work or other regular daily activities as a result of any emotional problems (such as feeling depressed or anxious)?
During the past 30 days, did you work or do other activities less carefully than usual as a result of an emotional problem (such as feeling depressed or anxious)?

ElementDescription: During the past 4 weeks, how much did your physical health or emotional problems limit your usual social activities with family or friends?
Notes: 1=Not at all; 2=A little bit; 3=Moderately; 4=Quite a bit;  5=Extremely; 999=Missing
